"Rabinovich et al. conducted experiments on preserving original author traits, particularly focusing on gender, in the context of Statistical Machine Translation (SMT) systems."
"Mirkin et al. suggested treating personalization of SMT systems as a domain-adaptation task, considering female and male gender as different domains."

Sennrich et al. worked on controlling politeness in machine translation by tagging training data with levels of politeness and are also mentioned in relation to domain adaptation in machine translation systems.
"Vanmassenhove and Hardmeier published a collection of parallel corpora for 20 language pairs under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License."
"Koehn is associated with the Europarl dataset, which contains speaker information used in the personalization of machine translation systems."
"The European Parliament is the source of speaker information used to tag parallel sentences with demographic details such as name, gender, age, and date of birth."
"Johnson et al. are referenced in the context of multilingual NMT systems, specifically Zero Shot Translation."
"Klein et al. are associated with the OpenNMT-py toolkit, which was used to train the NMT models in the described experiments."
"Europarl is a multilingual corpus with speaker information used in the analysis of gender distribution in machine translation systems."
"EN–FR is a language pair for which an annotated parallel dataset was published by Rabinovich et al. (2017) and analyzed for gender distribution in the Europarl dataset."
"EN–DE is one of the 10 language pairs for which experiments were conducted, with more than 500k annotated Europarl parallel sentences."
"EN–ES is one of the 10 language pairs used in the experiments, with gender tags added to sentences in the English source side."
"EN–EL is one of the language pairs included in the set of experiments on personalized machine translation systems."
"EN–PT is part of the 10 language pairs used in the experiments, where each sentence was augmented with a gender tag."
"EN–FI is included in the experiments on personalized machine translation, with gender-specific tags on the English source sentences."
"EN–IT is one of the language pairs for which personalized machine translation systems were trained with gender tags."
"EN–SV is part of the experiments on machine translation systems, with gender tags indicating the speaker's gender."
"EN–NL is one of the 10 language pairs used in the experiments, with gender tags added to the English source sentences."
"EN–DA is included in the set of 10 language pairs for which personalized machine translation systems were trained and evaluated."
"The license under which Vanmassenhove and Hardmeier published their collection of parallel corpora for 20 language pairs."
"Gender unbalance refers to the unequal distribution of male and female speakers in the Europarl dataset, affecting the translations produced by machine translation systems."
"Zero Shot Translation is an approach in multilingual NMT systems, referenced in the context of encoding sentence-specific information."
"Domain adaptation is a technique used in machine translation systems, mentioned in the context of encoding sentence-specific information."
"Multilingual NMT systems are systems capable of translating multiple language pairs, referenced in the context of encoding sentence-specific information."

relationships.description: "Rabinovich et al.'s work was influenced by Mirkin et al.'s suggestion to treat personalization of SMT systems as a domain-adaptation task."
"Rabinovich et al.'s work on speaker information tagging was followed by Vanmassenhove and Hardmeier, who published corpora for 20 language pairs."
"Vanmassenhove and Hardmeier used speaker information from the European Parliament to tag parallel sentences with demographic details."
"Koehn's Europarl dataset contains speaker information from the European Parliament, which was used for personalization of machine translation systems."
"Rabinovich et al. used the Europarl dataset by Koehn to tag parallel sentences with speaker information."

"Both Johnson et al. and Sennrich et al. are referenced in the context of encoding sentence-specific information for NMT systems, with Sennrich et al.'s work on politeness being particularly influential."
"The EN–FR language pair is part of the Europarl dataset, which was analyzed for gender distribution."
"The Europarl dataset exhibits a gender unbalance, which influences the translations produced by machine translation systems trained on this data."
"Rabinovich et al.'s work highlights the gender unbalance in the Europarl dataset and its impact on machine translation."

entities.description: "OpenNMT-py is a toolkit used for training NMT models, developed by Klein et al., 2017."
"Klein et al., 2017 are the developers of the OpenNMT-py toolkit used for training NMT models."
"LSTMs refer to Long Short-Term Memory units used as the recurrent unit in sequence-to-sequence encoder-decoders for NMT models."
"Bahdanau et al., 2014 are associated with the development of sequence-to-sequence encoder-decoders with LSTMs."
"Cho et al., 2014 are associated with the development of sequence-to-sequence encoder-decoders with LSTMs."
"Sutskever et al., 2014 are associated with the development of sequence-to-sequence encoder-decoders with LSTMs."
"BPE stands for Byte Pair Encoding, a word-segmentation method used to bypass the OOV problem and reduce dictionary entries."
"Sennrich, 2015 is associated with the development of the BPE algorithm used for word-segmentation."
"BLEU scores are a metric used to evaluate the performance of NMT systems, as presented in Table 2 and Table 3."
"French is a language for which the NMT systems were evaluated, particularly in terms of gender-related issues."
"Portuguese is a language for which the NMT systems were evaluated, particularly in terms of gender-related issues."
"Italian is a language for which the NMT systems were evaluated, particularly in terms of gender-related issues."
"Spanish is a language for which the NMT systems were evaluated, particularly in terms of gender-related issues."
"Greek is a language for which the NMT systems were evaluated, particularly in terms of gender-related issues."
"Danish is a language for which the NMT systems were evaluated, and showed a significant BLEU score improvement."
"Dutch is a language for which the NMT systems were evaluated, and did not show improvement."
"Finnish is a language for which the NMT systems were evaluated, and did not show improvement."
"German is a language for which the NMT systems were evaluated, and did not show improvement."
"Swedish is a language for which the NMT systems were evaluated, and did not show improvement."
"Papineni et al., 2002 are the authors of the BLEU score metric used for evaluating NMT systems."
"Newman et al. are referenced for their studies on corpus linguistics, showing gender effects on word choices and syntactic constructions."
"EN–FR systems refer to the English to French translation systems evaluated for gender-related performance issues."
"2K male-only and female-only test sets are used to evaluate system performance with respect to gender-related issues."
"NMT models refer to the neural machine translation models trained using the OpenNMT-py toolkit."
"Sequence-to-sequence encoder-decoders are the architecture of the NMT models, utilizing LSTMs as the recurrent unit."
"Word-segmentation with BPE is a method used to bypass the OOV problem and reduce the number of dictionary entries in NMT models."
"BPE algorithm refers to the Byte Pair Encoding algorithm used for word-segmentation with 89,500 operations."
"13 epochs is the number of times all systems were trained, with the best model selected for evaluation."
"Male/female tags are used to mark gender in the NMT systems to help with gender-related issues in languages with morphological agreement."
"Table 2 presents the BLEU scores for 10 baseline and 10 gender-enhanced NMT systems."
"Table 3 presents BLEU-scores on EN–FR comparing the baseline and the tagged systems on 4 different test sets."
"M represents the test set containing only male data used for evaluating the NMT systems."
"F represents the test set containing only female data used for evaluating the NMT systems."
"M1 represents the test set containing 1st person male data used for evaluating the NMT systems."
"F1 represents the test set containing 1st person female data used for evaluating the NMT systems."
"Vice-présidente is the French female form of vice-president, which appears in the translation produced by the BASE system."
"Heureux is the male form of the adjective 'happy' in French, which the baseline system outputs instead of the correct female form."
"Embarass´e is the male form produced by both BASE and TAG systems instead of the correct female forms 'embarass´ee' or 'gˆen´ee'."

relationships.description: "OpenNMT-py is the toolkit developed by Klein et al., 2017 for training NMT models."
